com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchattechdemo.activity_chooser

Class ChooserActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • android.support.v4.app.SupportActivity
              • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
                • android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
                  • com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchattechdemo.support.ActivityPrintStates
                    • com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchattechdemo.activity_chooser.ChooserActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, ActivityExtensions

    public class ChooserActivity
extends ActivityPrintStates
implements ActivityExtensions
    Display client UI to initiate connection requests and fork off a worker thread to listen for incoming connection requests. Use ChooserClient and ChooserListener, respectively, to perform the actual connect, then instantiate ChatActivity to manage the chat session. ChatActivity uses ChatServer to send and receive text over the Bluetooth connection. We will never need more than one ChooserClient and one ChooseListener and will never allow more than once ChatClient and associated ChatServer.

        onBluetoothToggle in interface ActivityExtensions

      • refreshUI

        void refreshUI(boolean clearRequest)
        Refresh the user interface when Bluetooth has been enabled.

        The background listener for incoming connection requests is started and stopped by onStart() and onStop(), respectively, as well as by ChooserBroadcastReceiver when Bluetooth is toggled.

      • refreshPaired

        void refreshPaired(boolean clearRequest)
        Find and displayShort devices which are already paired with this one.

      • refreshDiscovered

        void refreshDiscovered(boolean clearRequest)
        Refresh the list of "discovered" devices.

        When new devices are discovered, a broadcast is sent out. The "Discovered" RecyclerView is updated by the BroadcastReceiver. See ChooserBroadcastReceiver.onReceive(android.content.Context, android.content.Intent).
